intro: Festuca rubra var. littoralis, commonly known as coastal bentgrass, is a low-growing grass species native to coastal regions. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to salt spray and wind exposure. The plant has fine,丛生的 leaves that form dense mats, providing erosion control along shorelines.
